meanings.definition: Copyreaders: people who read and correct written material for publication.
meanings.sent1: The copyreaders carefully checked for any mistakes in the article.
meanings.sent2: The copyreaders work diligently to ensure the text is error-free before printing.
meanings.sent3: The copyreaders found a funny typo in the story and had a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: The copyreaders are the unsung heroes of the publishing world, polishing every word.
meanings.sent5: The copyreaders' keen eyes catch even the smallest errors, making the text flawless.

meanings.definition: Copyreaders: the act of reading and correcting written material for publication.
meanings.sent1: The copyreaders of the magazine meticulously review each page before it goes to print.
meanings.sent2: Copyreaders play a crucial role in ensuring the quality of published content.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, the copyreaders joked about the misplaced commas they found.
meanings.sent4: The copyreaders' job is like being detectives, hunting down errors in the text.
meanings.sent5: The copyreaders' dedication to perfection shines through in their meticulous work.
